alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 18 at 9:50AM EDT until August 18 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NORFOLK...SUFFOLK...SOUTHEASTERN MIDDLESEX AND NORTHWESTERN PLYMOUTH COUNTIES... At 949 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Braintree, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Boston, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Somerville, Malden, Brookline, Weymouth, Revere, Everett, Braintree, Chelsea, Randolph, Norwood, Milton, Stoughton, Dedham, Walpole, Easton, and Hingham. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
